title: dahal-lashes-out-oli
news:
KATHMANDU, DEC 21 - 
	UCPN (Maoist) Chairman Pushpa Kamal Dhal has lashed out at CPN-UML Chairman KP Sharma Oli.

“Oli is not the contractor or the king of this nation,” said leader Dahal, talking to media persons after meeting Constituent Assembly (CA) Chairman Subash Nembang at CA building in Nayabaneshwor, Kathmandu.

On Saturday, the UCPN (Maoist) leaders walked out of the “decisive meeting” convened at the prime minister’s official residence in Baluwater right after UML leader Oli delivered his speech.  In his speech, Oli said that the UCPN (Maoist) had been obstructing the constitution drafting process by forming the alliance of opposition parties and urged the latter to dissolve it.

The UCPN (Maoist) leaders were enraged after Oli said the new constitution should be drafted through procedure if the parties cannot forge agreement.

Leader Dahal vehemently ruled out the possibility of drafting the new constitution by January 22 deadline if the there was no consensus.  The UCPN (M) leader said his party walked of the meeting after Oli urged to dissolve the alliance.

Along with other leaders aligned to Federal Democratic Alliance (FDA), Dahal went to meet CA Chairman Nembang.  The leaders of the front urged Nembang to take initiatives to draft the new constitution through consensus.
